archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the 4-H All Stars Papers must be obtained from the Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 4-H all stars Papers, RG 26/4 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The 4-H all stars Papers were donated to the Special Collections in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement and description of the 4-H all stars Papers commenced in November 2005 and was completed in December 2005. In processing this collection, any publications found were removed and catalogued.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The 4-H all stars, Virginia Chapter, was launched on August 4, 1922. With the help of three West Virginia all stars (West Virginia had established the first all star Chapter in 1919 and helped Maryland in 1921), the Virginia Chapter initiated its original 12 members. all star membership is based on leadership, service, and activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The papers of the Virginia Chapter of the 4-H all stars span the years 1991-2003. The collection includes minutes, correspondence, financial reports, bylaws and policies, membership rosters, and photographs. It also includes the organization's mission statement and constitution. In addition to information about the local chapter, the collection contains materials about the Interstate Order of 4-H all stars and about the midwinter and summer conferences.

The 75th Anniversary Folder contains a publication about the history of the Virginia Chapter of the 4-H all stars, as well as a program of the festivities and a registration list for the celebration held in September of 1997.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by subject matter and each subject is organized chronologically.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Copies of the serial publication, The Virginia Stars, were pulled from the collection and cataloged.

did.unittitle: Photocopies of publications pulled from collection n.d.
